description: Shifts left when Stirling-2 transform applied twice.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..120
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210.
maple: stirtr:= proc(p)           proc(n) add(p(k)*combinat[stirling2](n, k), k=0..n) end         end:a:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n<2, 1, aa(n-1)) end:aa:= (stirtr@@2)(a):seq (a(n), n=1..25);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 22 2012
mathematica: stirtr[p_] := Function[{n}, Sum[p[k]*StirlingS2[n, k], {k, 0, n}]]; a[n_] := a[n] = If[n < 2, 1, aa[n-1]]; aa := stirtr[stirtr[a]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 25}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Oct 30 2013, translated from Alois P. Heinz's Maple program *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
